subject: Re: [junit] I can't find LoadingTestRunner
msgSnippet: Chris, junit 3.4 is loading by default. In case you want to use a non loading arrangement you need to have a junit.properties file in your home directory with
messageBody:
Chris,

junit 3.4 is loading by default. In case you want to use a non
loading arrangement you need to have a junit.properties file in your home
directory with this line

loading=false

The release notes provide more information.

Rama


Christians Izquierdo wrote:

> Hi
>
> I downloaded my JUnit 3.4 version from www.junit.com and I can't find
> the LoadingTestRunner class that's mentioned in the documentation, can
> someone please tell me where can I find it?
>
> Thanks,
> Chris
